meanings.definition: Braceros: plural form of bracero, a Mexican laborer allowed into the US for a limited time as a seasonal agricultural worker.
meanings.sent1: The braceros worked hard in the fields under the hot sun.
meanings.sent2: Many braceros traveled to the United States to help with the harvest.
meanings.sent3: The braceros had a race to see who could pick the most tomatoes.
meanings.sent4: The fields were a sea of braceros, each one a vital piece of the farming puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The image of the braceros toiling in the fields stayed with him long after he left.

meanings.definition: Braceros: workers who perform manual labor, especially in agriculture.
meanings.sent1: The braceros harvested the crops with skill and dedication.
meanings.sent2: Farmers relied on braceros to help with the demanding work on the farm.
meanings.sent3: The braceros had a friendly competition to see who could lift the most crates.
meanings.sent4: In the fields, the braceros were like ants, each one carrying a heavy load.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the braceros working together was a testament to their hard work.
